statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -5 \\ 3 \\ -4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -5 \\ -5 \\ -1 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 20 \\ 12 \\ 7 \end{array}\right] are or are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^3

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -5 \\ 3 \\ -4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -5 \\ -5 \\ -1 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 20 \\ 12 \\ 7 \end{array}\right] are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^3.
